intro: Cryptantha linearis var. sericea, commonly known as the silky cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its hairy stems and leaves give it a silvery appearance, which helps reduce water loss in dry conditions. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along stream banks.
